Praise ye the LORD. Sing unto the LORD a new song, <FI>and<Fi> his praise in the congregation of saints.<RF>Praise…: Heb. Halleluiah<Rf>
Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
Let them praise his name in the dance: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.<RF>in…: or, with the pipe<Rf>
For the LORD taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.
Let the saints be joyful in glory: let them sing aloud upon their beds.<CM>
<FI>Let<Fi> the high <FI>praises<Fi> of God <FI>be<Fi> in their mouth, and a twoedged sword in their hand;<RF>mouth: Heb. throat<Rf>
To execute vengeance upon the heathen, <FI>and<Fi> punishments upon the people;
To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;
To execute upon them the judgment written: this honour have all his saints. Praise ye the LORD.<CM>
